PermissibleValues.value: Mobilization with G-CSF + as needed plerixafor rescue
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stem Cell Mobilization Therapy With Granulocyte Colony-Stimulating Factor And As Necessary Plerixafor

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stem Cell Mobilization Therapy With Granulocyte Colony-Stimulating Factor And As Necessary Plerixafor
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Therapy to cause release of stem cells from the bone marrow into the peripheral blood circulation for the purpose of collection.: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.: Granulocyte colony-stimulating factor (207 aa, ~22 kDa) is encoded by the human CSF3 gene. This protein is involved in the regulation of the production, differentiation, and function of granulocytes.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: As needed, usually referring to the timing of the administration of a treatment or medication.: A bicyclam with hematopoietic stem cell-mobilizing activity. Plerixafor blocks the binding of stromal cell-derived factor (SDF-1alpha) to the cellular receptor CXCR4, resulting in hematopoietic stem cell (HSC) release from bone marrow and HSC movement into the peripheral circulation.

Concepts.definition: Therapy to cause release of stem cells from the bone marrow into the peripheral blood circulation for the purpose of collection.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
Granulocyte colony-stimulating factor (207 aa, ~22 kDa) is encoded by the human CSF3 gene. This protein is involved in the regulation of the production, differentiation, and function of granulocytes.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
As needed, usually referring to the timing of the administration of a treatment or medication.

A bicyclam with hematopoietic stem cell-mobilizing activity. Plerixafor blocks the binding of stromal cell-derived factor (SDF-1alpha) to the cellular receptor CXCR4, resulting in hematopoietic stem cell (HSC) release from bone marrow and HSC movement into the peripheral circulation.

An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
An unvarying or habitual method or procedure.

A bicyclam with hematopoietic stem cell-mobilizing activity. Plerixafor blocks the binding of stromal cell-derived factor (SDF-1alpha) to the cellular receptor CXCR4, resulting in hematopoietic stem cell (HSC) release from bone marrow and HSC movement into the peripheral circulation.
